statement:
My work explores the intersection of traditional artistic practices and contemporary themes. Through various media including printmaking, painting, and installation, I investigate the relationships between artistic expression and community engagement.

I am particularly interested in creating accessible art experiences that bridge diverse communities, as demonstrated by my work with Living Studios supporting artists with neurological and physical disabilities. My artistic practice combines technical skill with collaborative approaches, ensuring that art can be both personally expressive and socially impactful.

By balancing formal artistic training with real-world applications, my work invites viewers to consider the role of art in fostering connection and community. I strive to create pieces that are both visually compelling and conceptually meaningful, using my diverse skill set in set design, scenic painting, printmaking, and digital media to create multifaceted artistic experiences.
bioContent:
Amie Holstein is a multidisciplinary artist based in Salem, Oregon, whose work spans traditional and contemporary media. Currently completing her Bachelor of Arts in Studio Art with minors in Business and Art History at Willamette University, Amie maintains an impressive 3.87 GPA while actively contributing to the arts community.

With extensive experience as a Student Art Coordinator, Living Studios Intern, and Scenic Studio Supervisor, Amie has developed a diverse skill set that includes installation work, supporting artists with disabilities, and leading collaborative art projects. Her technical abilities encompass scenic painting, printmaking techniques including cyanotype and intaglio, welding, woodworking, and digital design.

Amie's artistic practice is complemented by her commitment to accessibility and inclusion in creative spaces. Her work has been recognized with multiple prestigious awards including the Joseph T Albert Prize, Robert Hess Award, and Jesse E. West Award. Her exhibitions include the upcoming Senior Art Thesis Exhibition at the Hallie Ford Museum of Art and multiple appearances in juried shows, including winning Best in Show at the 7th Annual Juried Art Show.
